intro: Aporosa pseudoficifolia, commonly known as the false Chinese lantern, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its compound leaves with three to five leaflets. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruits are follicles that split open to release seeds. It is native to Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
